title: Plant Growth: Auxins and Gibberellins | Plants | Biology | FuseSchool

tasks.task: Explain plant tropisms and hormones related to growth direction.
subtasks: Describe phototropism and how auxin affects stem growth toward light.
Explain auxin distribution in stems under light and shade.
Describe geotropism in roots and stems, highlighting auxin's opposing effects on each.
Describe the role of cytokinins in seed germination and energy provision.
Outline gibberellins' influence on shoot growth, flowering, and stem elongation.
Discuss the combined effects of auxins and gibberellins on plant growth.

tasks.task: Summarize the video's content on plant hormone functions.
subtasks: Mention the video covering plant tropisms and hormone uses.
Recall that auxin production in stem tips is necessary for phototropism.
Explain that covering stem tips disrupts phototropism, leading to straight growth.
Highlight the interaction between auxins and cytokinins in root growth regulation.

tasks.task: Understand the application of plant hormones in agriculture.
subtasks: Consider how auxins, cytokinins, and gibberellins could be used in farming practices.
